title: Purification After Childbirth
summary: Leviticus 12 provides instructions for ceremonial purification after childbirth. A woman is considered unclean for a period of time and must bring offerings afterward to be purified.

faq.question: How long was a woman considered unclean after childbirth?
faq.answer: Forty days for a male child and eighty days for a female child.

faq.question: What offerings were required after purification?
faq.answer: A burnt offering and a sin offering, usually a lamb and a dove or pigeon (or two birds if poor).
